gameDescription: Two specialized airships embark on a critical mission to transport pangolins from the clutches of poachers in Africa to a newly built pangolin enclosure in Vietnam. Guided by the noble cause, the actions of the airship crews will define the fate of these heavily-trafficked mammals.

setting.location: Above the African Savannah to Vietnam
setting.missionEnd: Newly Built Pangolin Enclosure in Vietnam

blueTeam.name: Sanctuary Saviours
blueTeam.description: Experts in wildlife rescue and onboard animal care.

redTeam.name: Conservation Couriers
redTeam.description: Specialists in surveillance, security and cargo handling.

turns.scenario: Both airships are preparing to rescue pangolins from poacher camps. They must decide the best strategy.

options.A: Conduct a stealthy night-time mission, risking alerting the poachers but minimizing stress for the pangolins.
options.B: Perform a daytime raid with local law enforcement, ensuring safety but potentially distressing the pangolins.

AA.narrative: Both teams opt for the stealth operation. The risk pays off as they rescue pangolins undetected, ensuring their safety with minimal distress.

AB.narrative: One team's stealthy approach contrasts with the other's daylight raid. The stealthy team saves more pangolins but raises security concerns; the day raid reassures authorities of ongoing partnerships.

BA.narrative: Differing strategies pinpoint the complexities of conservational work. The day raid validates stringent security but faces criticism over animal distress; the stealthy team successfully rescues pangolins facing logistical difficulties.

BB.narrative: With coordinated day raids, both teams rescue a significant number of pangolins. However, the stressful conditions compel the teams to reconsider their approach.

turns.scenario: En route to Vietnam, the airships must decide how to provide the best care for the rescued pangolins.

options.A: Create a natural on-board environment for the pangolins to recover during travel.
options.B: Keep pangolins in secure, standard crates for safety and monitor them rigorously.

AA.narrative: Both teams engineer onboard 'mini-habitats', allowing the pangolins to recover naturally. The innovation is commendable, but resources are stretched thin.

AB.narrative: One team's natural habitat contrasts with the other's rigorous monitoring. The habitats accelerate pangolin recovery while the other team's vigilance minimizes transit risks.

BA.narrative: With one team monitoring closely and the other providing natural habitat, the teams achieve a blend of biological care and logistical control, setting a standard for future rescue missions.

BB.narrative: Choosing secure crates and rigorous monitoring, both teams prioritize safety. The pangolins' health stabilizes, demonstrating the effectiveness of standardized wildlife transit procedures.

turns.scenario: Arriving in Vietnam, the airships must decide how to best introduce the pangolins to their new sanctuary.

options.A: Gradually introduce pangolins to the new environment to limit potential stress.
options.B: Rapidly introduce pangolins to new environment to maximise acclimation time before breeding season.

AA.narrative: Choosing gradual introduction, both teams demonstrate a deep understanding of animal psychology. However, as the breeding season nears, time pressure grows.

AB.narrative: One team's cautious approach contrasts with the other's urgency. Both methods see success, sparking discussions about optimal rehabilitation processes.

BA.narrative: One team speeds up acclimation while the other takes a gradual approach. The swift team's results inspire but face scrutiny over pangolin stress levels.

BB.narrative: Both teams fast-track the pangolins into their new home. The gamble pays off as the pangolins adapt well and breeders express optimism.
